definition: not to do one's best/not to exert oneself
(negative prefix)/not/no
power/force/strength/ability/strenuously
surname Li

sentences.english: But hopes for a breakthrough have been frustrated by poor implementation.
sentences.chinese: 然而，執行不力令突破現狀的希望落空。

sentences.english: Even if the militia battles dint no, also can by ship withdraw.
sentences.chinese: 即使陸軍作戰不力，也可以乘船撤回來。

sentences.english: It was the result of regulatory inaction and infighting.
sentences.chinese: 此次疫情是政府監管不力和內訌的結果。

sentences.english: The second one is to correct the inefficiency and deviation of the Zhasake Banner in the league-and-banner system.
sentences.chinese: 二是爲了糾正盟旗制度下旗札薩克管理的不力與偏差。

sentences.english: We should not confuse lack of implementation with lack of evidence.
sentences.chinese: 我們不應當把實施不力與缺少依據混爲一談。

sentences.english: Blame for any shortcomings has tended to land on local-government officials.
sentences.chinese: 任何對救災不力的指責似乎都瞄準了當地官員。

sentences.english: As his staff did not perform well in their jobs, Mr. B failed in his business.
sentences.chinese: 先生的生意失敗，是由於他的員工工作不力的緣故。

sentences.english: However, the Chinese Embassy did not try its best in bargaining for fear of hurting the China-Iraq relation and other considerations.
sentences.chinese: 但中國使館以中伊關係等多種考慮而交涉不力。

sentences.english: The same indecisiveness characterised the Chia-ching reign on other fronts.
sentences.chinese: 嘉靖在位期間的決策不力還體現在其他戰線。

sentences.english: The company has faced stinging criticism over its handling of the spill.
sentences.chinese: 由於對漏油事件處理不力，該公司面臨嚴厲批評。

sentences.english: Those journalists have criticized his feeble efforts in handling the crises.
sentences.chinese: 那些記者抨擊他在處理危機時措施不力。

definition: to fail in observing or supervising/to miss/to let sth slip through
to lose one's job/unemployment/not to fulfill one's obligations/to neglect one's job/dereliction of duty
breach of responsibility/failure to carry out one's duty
to neglect one's duty/dereliction of duty/malpractice
inappropriate/improper
wrongdoing/failure to do one's duty
cannot escape censure (idiom)/has to bear the blame
to hold accountable/to blame/to censure/to apportion blame
to be responsible for
to skimp on the job/to work half-heartedly/not to take the job seriously
to abscond/to be absent without leave
to cover up (a matter that should be reported to the authorities)
to fail to pay sufficient attention to/to be negligent in regard to/to be lacking in
to neglect/to overlook/negligence/carelessness
to avoid (esp. responsibility)/to shift (the blame)/to pass the buck
at fault/blamed for/responsible (for a blunder or crime)
